extends java.lang.Object
    Code for functions of mars rover.
    Version:
    9/17/18

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rover(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the variables to zero when creating a new rover.
      Rover(java.lang.String name, int x, int y, int dir)
      Sets the variables to a specific input value when creating a new rover.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void chainsaw(Rover other)
      This is an attack using a chainsaw to another rover to deal damage and possibly kill.
      void charge(int n)
      This gives the rover and inputed amount of energy.
      void flamethrower(Rover other)
      This is an attack using a flamethrower on another rover to deal damage and possible burn to a crisp.
      void getDirectionName()
      Gives the name of the direction the rover is facing based on numerical value.
      void goHome()
      This takes the rover back the location in which it was instantiated.
      void megaKick(Rover other)
      This is the best and most risky attack as there is a 50/50 chance to deal a very small amount of damage and to deal a very large amount of damage.
      void move(int n)
      Moves the rover towards the direction it is facing for an inputed amount of units.
      void moveTo(int x, int y)
      This moves the rover to an inputed location using the move function and the rotate function.
      void rotate(int n)
      This will rotate the rover in either direction for an inputed amount of units.
      void rotateLeft()
      Rotates the rover to the left once.
      void rotateRight()
      Rotates the rover to the right once.
      void takePicture()
      This takes a picture of the location of the rover and stores it.
      void teleport(int x, int y)
      Teleports the rover to an input location.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Gives the name of rover, x/y position, direction, whether it is alive or not, number of pictures it has stored, health, and energy.
      void transmitPictures()
      This transmits the pictures stored back to Earth and resets the stored pictures back to zero.

        Sets the variables to zero when creating a new rover.

      • Rover

        public Rover(java.lang.String name,
             int x,
             int y,
             int dir)
        Sets the variables to a specific input value when creating a new rover.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the rover
        y - Y position of the rover
        dir - Directin the rover is facing.

    • Method Detail

      • chainsaw

        public void chainsaw(Rover other)
        This is an attack using a chainsaw to another rover to deal damage and possibly kill. The rover needs to be within in two units of the other rover in order to do this attack.
        Parameters:
        other - The other rover being attacked

      • charge

        public void charge(int n)
        This gives the rover and inputed amount of energy. The maximum it can charge to is sthree-hundred energy.
        Parameters:
        n - Amount of energy given to rover.

      • flamethrower

        public void flamethrower(Rover other)
        This is an attack using a flamethrower on another rover to deal damage and possible burn to a crisp. The rover needs to be within five units of the other rover in order to do this attack.
        Parameters:
        other - The other rover being burned

      • getDirectionName

        public void getDirectionName()
        Gives the name of the direction the rover is facing based on numerical value.

      • goHome

        public void goHome()
        This takes the rover back the location in which it was instantiated.

      • megaKick

        public void megaKick(Rover other)
        This is the best and most risky attack as there is a 50/50 chance to deal a very small amount of damage and to deal a very large amount of damage. There is no distance the rover needs to cover to do this attack.
        Parameters:
        other - The other rover that could possibly die or could live with little health or have almost full health.

      • move

        public void move(int n)
        Moves the rover towards the direction it is facing for an inputed amount of units.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of units the rover will go forward in the direction it is facing

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(int x,
                   int y)
        This moves the rover to an inputed location using the move function and the rotate function.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate the rover will be moved to
        y - Y coordinate the rover will be moved to

      • rotate

        public void rotate(int n)
        This will rotate the rover in either direction for an inputed amount of units.
        Parameters:
        n - Direction and number of units of rotation

      • rotateLeft

        public void rotateLeft()
        Rotates the rover to the left once.

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight()
        Rotates the rover to the right once.

      • takePicture

        public void takePicture()
        This takes a picture of the location of the rover and stores it.

      • teleport

        public void teleport(int x,
                     int y)
        Teleports the rover to an input location.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate the rover will be teleported to
        y - Y coordinate the rover will be teleported to

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gives the name of rover, x/y position, direction, whether it is alive or not, number of pictures it has stored, health, and energy.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • transmitPictures

        public void transmitPictures()
        This transmits the pictures stored back to Earth and resets the stored pictures back to zero.
